snippet: ISIS seized more than 200 Assyrians in February when its fighters overran more than a dozen villages near the northeastern city of Hasaka.
abstract: Syrian Observatory for Human Rights says Islamic State has released 22 of dozens of Assyrian Christians abducted by group from northeastern Syria in February.
lead_paragraph: ISIS seized more than 200 Assyrians in February when its fighters overran more than a dozen villages near the northeastern city of Hasaka.

headline.main: Syria: Islamic State Frees 22 Assyrian Christians
headline.print_headline: Middle East; Syria: Islamic State Frees 22 Assyrian Christians

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
